messages.messageBody:
--- In NHEN-SpeakOut@y..., laderrick@a... wrote:

Homeschooling in the News, from the National Home Education Network

Homeschooling in the News returns after an unscheduled two week
break, in which a cross-country move, illness and internet access
problems all played a part. We're back up and will be sending out
digests regularly again. Because the backlog of articles is
extensive, in-depth articles are included in this digest, and
immediately following will be a digest of minor mentions.

May 30
CNN.com : Tech ballet: The work-life balance challenge
http://www.cnn.com/2001/CAREER/trends/05/30/balancing.acts.idg/index.html
Doug Sjoquist alternates intense work periods with lighter stretches,
home-schools his four children and is building his dream home in the
country.

Sun Herald : Ocean Springs speller advances to Round 2
http://web.sunherald.com:80/content/biloxi/2001/05/30/pageone/4212432_05302001.htm
Josh Hanssen had much to celebrate Tuesday. He turned 14 and he made
it to the second day of the 74th annual Scripps Howard National
Spelling Bee.

Kokomo Tribune : Kokomo speller advances
http://www.ktonline.com/cgi-bin/LiveIQue.acgi$rec=284113?kt_story
Homeschooled speller advances to final day.

Bangor News : Maine spelling bee champ makes second round of national bee
http://www.bangornews.com/cgi-bin/article.cfm?storynumber=35314

Examiner News : Merit scholars announced
http://examiner.net/stories/053001/new_new40001.shtml
One of two are National Merit Scholars is homeschooled

May 29
Washington Post : Students Transfer From Home to School
http://washingtonpost.com:80/wp-dyn/education/highereducation/A94378-2001May29.html
Becky Worden didn't have a high school graduation. And she didn't
take the SAT. But at 17, she has a community college degree.

ABC News : Home Schoolers Lead Spelling Bee
http://abcnews.go.com/sections/wnt/WorldNewsTonight/wnt010529_homeschoolers.html
Ten percent of the finalists in the Scripps Howard National Spelling
Bee are homeschooled. Advocates of public education say spelling bees
prove little beyond a mastery of memorization.

Flint Journal : Institute offers home schooling alternative
http://fl.mlive.com/news/index.ssf?/news/stories/20010529f29a4issachar.frm
A small Christian school that attracts homeschoolers holds classes in
a hotel owned by the Institute of Basic Life Principles.

Alabama Live : Some Pennsylvania school districts fight 'cyber' charter schools
http://www.al.com/newsflash/index.ssf?/cgi-free/getstory_ssf.cgi?a0433_BC_CyberSchools_991116941&&news&newsflash-national
Article about cyber charters and a lawsuit alleging they are not
permitted under the law.

Keys News : School adopts new curriculum
http://stories.keysnews.com/cgi-bin/LiveIQue.acgi$rec=5945?CurrentNews
A Key West school adopts a home-school curriculum for a hybrid
alternative school program.

Macon Telegraph : Home sweet school
http://www.macontelegraph.com/content/macon/2001/05/29/features/GENHOMESCHOOL_MAIN_0529.htm
Article about a Christian homeschooling conference.

May 28
Albuquerque Tribune : C-U-L-M-I-N-A-T-I-O-N
http://www.abqtrib.com/archives/news01/052801_news_sarahbee.shtml
Homeschooled speller heads to national bee.

Associated Press : two photos of a homeschooler preparing to take an
online test
http://dailynews.yahoo.com/h/p/ap/20010528/us/cyber_schools_pack101.html
http://dailynews.yahoo.com/h/p/ap/20010528/us/cyber_schools_pack102.html

May 27
New York Times : Five Determined Students, Five Unusual Routes to a
College Degree
http://www.nytimes.com/2001/05/27/national/27GRAD.html
Joshua Cullen has a degree from the University of Michigan, summa cum
laude, but also an under-17 driver's license that requires him to be
off the road by midnight.

Amarillo Globe-News : Amarillo speller heads to national bee
http://www.amarillonet.com/stories/052701/new_amaspeller.shtml
Another homeschooled speller goes to the bee.

Salt Lake Tribune : At Henry College, It's God, Grades and the GOP
http://www.sltrib.com/05272001/nation_w/100703.htm
Patrick Henry College, which just completed its inaugural year, is
the nation's first institution of higher learning created
specifically with the home-schooled student in mind. Its values are
conservative and strict teetotaler.

May 25
CBN News : In one of its top stories, CBN News reported that Home
Education Magazine's domain name has been purchased by an overseas
company trafficking pornography. No link.

May 24
LA Times : Top of his class
http://www.latimes.com/communities/news/oc_beach_cities/20010524/thb0004754.html
He is a Web designer, an agent and will soon be a teacher. And he's
only 11. This summer, Joshua Ballard will teach the class "Future
Millionaires and Junior Entrepreneurship" at Golden West College.

May 23
Black World Today : Home Schooling: A Happy Exit From High School
http://www.tbwt.com/content/article.asp?articleid=736
Megan Moss writes about her experience of leaving high school to homeschool.

Orange County Register : Solving the crunch
http://www.ocregister.com/news/capo400523cci.shtml
Orange County's schools will add an additional 42,000 students over
the next five years. Innovative solutions include partnerships with
private businesses, home schooling or the traditional route of
passing a bond.

May 22
Akron Beacon Journal : Safe at the plate
http://www.ohio.com/bj/sports/docs/001379.htm
Baseball player Chris Bando's family homeschools.

May 21
PR Newswire : Mathematical Association of America Announces 2001 USA
Math Olympiad Winners
http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT=104&STORY=/www/story/05-21-2001/0001498093&EDATE=
This year's USAMO winners are led by first place finisher Reid
Barton, a home schooled student and four-time USAMO winner from
Arlington, MA.

Gazette : Home schooling on rise in Wisconsin
http://www.gazetteextra.com/homeschool052101.html
"The number of Wisconsin children educated at home has climbed to
more than 21,000, but little is done to see that those students are
taught according to state law."

Wired News : Homeschool Gets Sex Education
http://www.wired.com/news/school/0,1383,43933,00.html
Home Education Magazine lost its domain name, www.home-ed-press.com,
to a porn site. Please check for old links to this address on your
site.

Newschoice : Highland swimmer stroking to Holland
http://search.newschoice.com/GPC_StoryDisplay.asp?story=d:\index\newsarchives\gansun\loc\20010521\877374_n21maue.txt&searchtext=home-school
11-year-old homeschooled swimmer will be competing in a meet in the
Netherlands.

May 20
Orlando Sentinel : She knows ABCs of home schooling
http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/orl-biz-career20052001.story?coll=orl%2Dbusiness%2Dheadlines
A homeschool mom whose child is going back to school meets with a career coach.

American News : Parents upset about kids being bullied
http://web.aberdeennews.com/content/aberdeen/2001/05/20/front/2469643.htm
Story of school bullying. One family took their daughter out of
school to homeschool because of the bullying, and says she is back to
being a normal kid again.

Anniston Star : Sisters live and learn under the same roof
http://www.annistonstar.com/news/news_20010520_5272.html
Article about a homeschooling family and homeschooling in Alabama.

May 19
Tallahassee Democrat : In Stumbo case, government acts like Dumbo
http://web.tallahasseedemocrat.com/content/tallahassee/2001/05/19/opinion/0519.edit.parker.htm
A court of appeals ruled against the Stumbo family's claim of illegal
search and seizure. The case will go to the supreme court.

Bergen Record (From the Chicago Tribune) : Parents thrilled that
home-schoolers are busy at bees
http://www.bergen.com/ed/school19200105192.htm
A negative spin on homeschoolers winning bees.

Herald-Mail : Homeschool moms get support
http://www.herald-mail.com/news/2001/05/19/local/Homeschool_moms_get_sup.html
Article about a Christian homeschool support group.

May 17
Herald-Mail : Family bugs out
http://www.herald-mail.com/news/2001/05/17/local/Family_bugs_out.html
A homeschooling family studies bugs.

May 16
The Courier : Teen-ager melds his photography with travel
http://www.zwire.com/site/news.cfm?newsid=1823997&BRD=1569&PAG=461&dept_id=180945&rfi=6
"Chris Bauer considers himself lucky. At the age of 16, the
home-schooled Woodlands teen-ager has traveled all over the world,
including Egypt, Turkey, Italy, Switzerland, Germany and 33 of the 50
states."

May 14
American Spectator : Home School, Sweet Home School
http://www.spectator.org/opinion/style/style010514.htm
Homeschooling families sue to gain access to community center facilities.


Laura Derrick
National Home Education Network
http://www.nhen.org

Permission is granted to forward or repost this digest or any links
included in it.

We try to pass along every news article in which homeschooling is
mentioned, without censoring, including negative articles or
unfortunate bits written about or associated with homeschooling. If
you are offended by an article, or if you especially like an article,
we encourage you to write the
editor with your comments.
--- End forwarded message ---
